intro: Guarea bilibil, commonly known as the sacred tree or kawa tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other hardwoods. The tree is characterized by its smooth, dark bark and elongated, elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. Its flowers are small and clustered, producing a distinctive, fragrant odor. The fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release flat, winged seeds, aiding in wind dispersal.
